content: Who wrote the classic novel "Pride and Prejudice"?

"Pride and Prejudice" is a classic novel written by Jane Austen. It was first published in 1813 and has since become one of the most beloved and widely read works of English literature. The novel revolves around the five Bennet sisters and their experiences with love, marriage, and societal expectations in early 19th-century England. Austen's mastery of wit, irony, and social commentary has solidified her place as one of the greatest writers in the English language.
